title: Nice and warm

title: Nicely made, great value, trusted brand!
body: Bought this for my son in the fall. He goes through hats like crazy, they usually tear at the top.This hat is very sturdy, nice quality item at a great price from Carhartt. I love the bright orange color - even though his coat is red and black, this hat still manages to look cool, and I can pick him out of a crowd when he wears it!Material is nice and sturdy, and it was a great buy! Highly recommend it!

title: This will keep your head and ears nice and toasty
body: The warmest watch cap I've tried. This will keep your head and ears nice and toasty.

title: Simple warm hat
body: Basic but very comfortable and warm.  I've been wearing it out walking in the pre-dawn cold (teens) in Chicago area and it keeps my head and ears comfortable.  I like the orange color - easy to see.  Simple product well done.

title: Great hat

They provide good warmth for a cold day.  If it gets into the 40s or I am really working, I'll have to take it off for a while.

title: Five Stars
body: Great fit

title: Carhartt's excellent-outstanding  quality
body: Typical outstanding Carthart quality.  The actual color of the hat is darker than the picture.  The one size offered fits a normal sized head. 'Carhartt Work In Progress (Carhartt WIP) is the avant-garde way of living the Carhartt brand, reshaping the outstanding Carhartt legacy.In 1889, Hamilton Carhartt founded the Carhartt company in Detroit. His first products were work overalls made of denim fabric and duck, commonly called canvas. This later became Carhartt's trademark fabric. Since the early years the brand became dedicated to providing 'Best In Class' apparel, tailored to meet the highest standards of quality, durability and comfort.Founded in 1994, Work In Progress initiated a distribution network for Carhartt across Europe, introducing a selection of classic products from the original work wear range into a new market. Success was immediate; the authentic Carhartt products quickly became popular with both fans of traditional US heritage garments and with the nascent European urban culture scene.The first product range designed exclusively by Work In Progress for Europe followed in 1997. Since then, under license and never without the expressed consent of the company HQ in Dearborn, Michigan, Carhartt WIP has carefully adapted, re-interpreted and re-fitted work wear cuts for the demands of an active life in the urban environment, remaining true to Carhartt's core values: quality, durability and comfort and becoming the globally respected contemporary brand that is today.'  Quote from the Carhartt website.

title: Perfect fit. High quality.
body: My husband works outdoor a lot and he can get quite cold. Sometimes his job demands he be out even if it's icing,.snowing, really cold, etc. I am always looking for ways to make him more comfy.  This is a very practical warm hat. He loves it. He's 6'2" and fit is perfect. Great quality. It is exactly what you would expect from Carthartt.

title: Love it!
body: Great hat!  Warm, breatheable and inexpensive!  I wear this hat before my North Face or Columbia hats.  So comfortable to wear.

title: A 5-star hat, but that label...
body: I like everything about this had except the Carhartt label which is sewn on the outside where everyone will see it. It is a plain and unattractive label. I just spent five minutes carefully cutting the threads that secured the label to the hat and removing the label. Now the hat is great. It's well-made. Even though I have a large head, it stretches enough that I can wear it comfortably. It looks good. The hat is long enough that you will need to either turn up the edge of it so it is doubled, or you will have the medieval/Gumby look if you wear it like a beanie. Actually, I like that look too. The hat is very warm. I expect to get many years of good use out of it.

title: Great product

title: perfect
body: Perfect.. perfect price perfect hat...that's it!

title: A decent size for a large head
body: I have a large head and I am constantly frustrated by how tiny most hats are, now that almost everything is made in China. This hat actually covers my ears!I have a large enough head that I don't use the "default" crease you see in the pic. To cover my ears,  I have to crease it just below the Carhartt logo tag.The washing directions said "Hand wash only," which was an annoying surprise (I missed that in the ad, so that was on me). I machine washed and dryed and did not notice any issues.At this price, I am ordering a couple more for backups and emergencies.

title: Boys love them
body: I bought two of these hats as stocking stuffers for my sons, ages eight and 10. Both boys are into the outdoors; hiking, shooting, slingshots and archery.The boys have worn them daily since receiving them; just about every picture I have of them includes one or both of them wearing these hats.It's a true hunter's orange and stands out well against snow and in the trees. My husband tried one on and said that it fits him fine.

title: Comfortable hat
body: This is a very comfortable hat.  I would have preferred it to be a bit more snug though, and I wear a 7 3/8 size hat.  Also it is very easy to remove that ugly tag.

title: Purchased as a Christmas gift, and he wears it ...
body: Purchased as a Christmas gift, and he wears it so often that I had to get my friend a second one so that his girlfriend could wash one while he wore the other.

title: Five Stars

title: Lives up to the Carhatt name.
body: My husband was looking for a good hat to wear during the colder nights at work, and this one works great.  It's nice and warm with a great length.  The Carhartt's patch is somewhat irritating (hey, they gotta advertise their brand someway) but certainly liveable.  All in all, it's great quality and is what one would expect from Carhartt.

title: Great fit, comfort, + warmth
body: Love this hat! I was worried it might be the wrong size since it's for men, but the fit is perfect. It's large enough to wear pulled down below your ears. The material is sturdy with the right amount of stretch & has kept my head warm this winter on night time bike rides, walking around in the wind, & in poorly heated buildings. Also, I love that they're a Michigan brand & made in the USA. I will definitely buy another if/when this one wears out many years from now.

title: Ca ca ca ca carhartt!
body: Fits my big ol' head and keeps my ears warm. You guys out there with huge, planetoid-like heads have no fear! This hat will fit you. One reviewer said to put it on your head wet and let it dry for a more custom fit. I'm sure this works but i prefer to let my goopy head oils shape the hat like an snakey second skin to my head.Also, if you engage in ninja-like action packed hikes with your dog like I do, this hat fits tight enough that it wont come off your head! Even when doing back flips!

title: Very nice.
body: My local store that carries these had sold out of all the good colors, so I opted to check Amazon, where I found a very good price (better than the stores), and a better selection. I am a big fan of Carhartt stuff, because I think they are all about quality. This beanie is no exception - it has held up just fine, fit perfectly, and most importantly, kept me plenty warm! I would recommend this beanie to anyone looking for a durable, warm winter beanie.

title: Perfect watch cap for cold weather
body: - Solid build quality, thick, warm, and soft.- Stands up to Chicago winter (I just walked through -10 degree windchill, and felt nothing from the ears up).- Made in the USA (USA! USA!)For the price, I can't imagine a better product. I doubt I'll buy a winter hat in a shop ever again if Carhartt keeps up this level of quality.One small fashion note- navy blue is very, VERY dark. Bordering on black. It's darker than my navy blue greatcoat. Not a big deal, unless it is in your case.

title: Nice warm hat, but quality control lacking

The outside of the hat was flawless, but when I turned it out later I found a nice ¾ tear in the inside layer. I doubt the seller could have seen this.

title: Actual color is way off from web site image.
body: While this is a well made hat, its dense and warm and I dont feel any draft getting though it on cold days like I do with a lot of other winter hats Ive owned. The actual color looks a lot different than on the web site. I ordered the dk brown which looked more "medium toned" or "heathered" on the web site. Its actually a very dark , rich tone of dark brown. If the color was what I expected when i ordered it I would have given 5 stars. I like the product itself but will shop from Carhartt retailer next time to get a good look at the color tone before purchasing.

The knit is tight but with quite a bit of elasticity built in. Overall a fantastic value for a warm knit cap that will hold up for a long time.

title: Hat Color Does Not Match Scarf of "Same" Color
body: Company's products of same color totally do not match. Hat Canyon Brown is much lighter shade than is Carhartt Men's Series 1889 Knit Scarf Color Canyon Brown sold by BareBones WorkWear which is more a dark olive brown. Hat is a much smoother texture material than is the scarf. On their own each looks fine but totally do not match in texture or color. Just got these so don't know how well they wear over time.

body: Great hat for a cold winter morning.  Kept my head very warm.  The color was exactly as described.  It is a little lo get than I thought it would be but I just have to roll it up a little bit more.  Overall a great hat for an awesome price.

title: Better quality than a lot of knit hats I've had
body: Seems good quality.  Have not washed yet.
